page.title: 01The Wye Valley-introduction.
page.content: This area is mainly undulating countryside covered by mixed woodland and farmland,dissected by the rich fertile valley of the River Wye. Wildlife is abundant and foxes, deer, badgers and rabbits are commonly seen. There are a few scattered villages, namely The Narth,Pen-y-van,Llandogo, St.Briavels and Whitebrook.These small communities can be totally isolated in the winter by heavy falls of snow.They are served by limited public transport. Various other services,such as milk, library & health centre vans call regularly. The major industries of the area are tourism and farming.It is an area of outstanding natural beauty.
